Drugs.Name: Norvasc
Drugs.Description: Calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure.

Drugs.Name: Co-Diovan
Drugs.Description: Combination medication for blood pressure control.

Drugs.Name: Beloc ZOK
Drugs.Description: Beta-blocker for managing hypertension.

Treatment: Dietary management, exercise, oral hypoglycemics, insulin therapy

Drugs.Name: Glucophage
Drugs.Description: Helps control blood sugar levels.

Drugs.Name: Januvia
Drugs.Description: Assists in regulating insulin levels.

Drugs.Name: Lantus
Drugs.Description: Long-acting insulin for blood sugar control.

Drugs.Name: Plavix
Drugs.Description: Prevents blood clots in coronary arteries.

Drugs.Name: Lipitor
Drugs.Description: Lowers cholesterol levels.

Drugs.Name: Concor
Drugs.Description: Beta-blocker for heart rate control.

Drugs.Name: Spiriva
Drugs.Description: Long-acting bronchodilator for easier breathing.

Drugs.Name: Symbicort
Drugs.Description: Combination inhaler for inflammation and airflow.

Drugs.Name: Ventolin
Drugs.Description: Quick-relief inhaler for acute symptoms.

Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, hormonal therapy

Drugs.Name: Herceptin
Drugs.Description: Targets specific breast cancer cells.

Drugs.Name: Avastin
Drugs.Description: Inhibits blood vessel growth in tumors.

Drugs.Name: Taxol
Drugs.Description: Chemotherapy agent for various cancers.

Treatment: Dietary changes, antacids, proton pump inhibitors

Drugs.Name: Nexium
Drugs.Description: Reduces stomach acid production.

Drugs.Name: Gaviscon
Drugs.Description: Neutralizes stomach acid and forms a protective barrier.

Drugs.Name: Losec
Drugs.Description: Decreases acid secretion in the stomach.

Treatment: Physical therapy, pain management, surgical intervention

Drugs.Name: Arveles
Drugs.Description: Pain reliever for musculoskeletal conditions.

Drugs.Name: Muscoril
Drugs.Description: Muscle relaxant for relieving spasms.

Drugs.Name: Lyrica
Drugs.Description: Treats nerve pain associated with disc issues.

Symptoms: Difficulty sleeping due to breathing problems

Drugs.Name: Ventolin
Drugs.Description: Quick-relief inhaler for asthma attacks.

Drugs.Name: Seretide
Drugs.Description: Combination inhaler for long-term control.

Drugs.Name: Singulair
Drugs.Description: Oral medication for allergy-induced asthma.

Treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, cognitive therapy

Drugs.Name: Aricept
Drugs.Description: Improves cognitive function in Alzheimer's patients.

Drugs.Name: Exelon
Drugs.Description: Slows progression of symptoms.

Drugs.Name: Reminyl
Drugs.Description: Enhances memory and thinking skills.

Drugs.Name: Prozac
Drugs.Description: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor for mood improvement.

Drugs.Name: Cymbalta
Drugs.Description: Treats depression and anxiety.

Drugs.Name: Zoloft
Drugs.Description: Helps restore emotional balance.

Treatment: Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial. Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) are commonly prescribed to slow disease progression. Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and corticosteroids may be used to manage symptoms. Physical therapy and regular exercise can help maintain joint flexibility.

Drugs.Name: Methotrexate
Drugs.Description: A DMARD that slows disease progression.

Drugs.Name: Prednisone
Drugs.Description: A corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation.

Drugs.Name: Ibuprofen
Drugs.Description: An NSAID for pain and inflammation relief.

Treatment: Managing underlying conditions like diabetes and hypertension is essential. Dietary modifications, including reduced protein and sodium intake, are recommended. Medications to control blood pressure and cholesterol levels are prescribed. In advanced stages, dialysis or kidney transplantation may be necessary.

Drugs.Name: Lisinopril
Drugs.Description: An ACE inhibitor to control blood pressure.

Drugs.Name: Furosemide
Drugs.Description: A diuretic to reduce fluid buildup.

Drugs.Name: Erythropoietin
Drugs.Description: Stimulates red blood cell production.

Treatment: Treatment includes proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) to reduce stomach acid, antibiotics if Helicobacter pylori infection is present, and avoiding NSAIDs, alcohol, and smoking. Dietary changes such as avoiding spicy and acidic foods are also recommended.

Drugs.Name: Nexium
Drugs.Description: Proton pump inhibitor that reduces acid production.

Drugs.Name: Amoxicillin
Drugs.Description: Antibiotic used to treat H. pylori infection.

Drugs.Name: Maalox
Drugs.Description: Antacid that neutralizes stomach acid.

Treatment: Treatment involves identifying and managing the cause of iron deficiency. Oral or intravenous iron supplements are prescribed. In cases of chronic blood loss, underlying issues such as ulcers or heavy menstruation must be addressed.

Drugs.Name: Ferrosanol
Drugs.Description: Oral iron supplement to treat iron deficiency.

Drugs.Name: Ferrum Hausmann
Drugs.Description: Used for moderate to severe iron deficiency.

Drugs.Name: Venofer
Drugs.Description: IV iron therapy for rapid correction.

Treatment: Acute attacks are managed with triptans, NSAIDs, or antiemetics. Preventive treatments include beta-blockers, antiepileptic drugs, and lifestyle modifications such as stress management and avoiding triggers like caffeine and bright lights.

Drugs.Name: Imigran
Drugs.Description: Triptan used for acute migraine relief.

Drugs.Name: Naproxen
Drugs.Description: NSAID for reducing headache inflammation.

Drugs.Name: Topamax
Drugs.Description: Preventive medication to reduce frequency of attacks.
